content:
The full text does not change my previous interpretation significantly. It confirms that the text is describing a world that is controlled by gods, specifically a "heavenly kingdom" that is beyond the natural world and is inhabited by supernatural beings. The text emphasizes that these gods are in a realm that is higher than the sky, and from this realm, they can see everything in the world.
The phrase "次元を超越した" is used to emphasize the extraordinary nature of these gods and their realm. It is used to convey the idea that they have surpassed the limitations and boundaries of the human world in every way. They are in a realm that is beyond human comprehension, and they can see and understand things that are not possible for human beings to comprehend.
The context confirms that the text is describing a world of gods and supernatural entities, and the use of the phrase "次元を超越した" is intended to convey the idea that these gods and their realm are extraordinary and beyond human understanding.
